values: I'm getting ready for the Holidays...

It's been so long since I wrote an entry. Livejournal has even changed it's format since the last time.

I've thought about writing almost everyday. I have no idea why I never did. Not much to say. I wonder about Crow alot. I miss him, I miss Tony, I miss Michael. I work a lot, I waste a lot of time. I waste so much time. I haven't really accomplished anything lately. Seems like I should be writing all the time if I've got nothing important going on.

I got a letter from Crow a little while ago. I was so excited. I sat without opening it for at least half an hour savoring that I had it. Then thought about how stupid I was and that I was probably making a big deal out of something that would say, "I've had some time to think about things and I don't think we should have anything to do with each other anymore." 

So that's when I finally opened it.

It didn't say that. It was a bittersweet letter. I'm not sure I want to talk about it here, but I'm going to talk to him about it. Well, write to him about it. How sad it makes me that Crow is scared of himself. And I don't mean scared of himself like most people are-like they think they'll do something bad, they think they're a bad person...I just mean...I don't know. Maybe that he doesn't understand himself. And how he must not trust himself at all, not to allow himself to relax and accept himself.

I've got a black pussy cat outfit for halloween. :D

For the first time in my life, I'm living by myself. I have a small apartment. It's nice. It's expensive. I'm constantly inviting people over for anything so I don't have to think about being alone.

I'm learning to cook well, finally! Because I'm finding out here it's easier to get to know my nieghbors by offering food. :p

Sometimes it's nice being forced to meet new people. Sometimes it sucks and I just want somebody sincere who knows me to curl up on the couch with.

I feel like things are just more fake in my life without the SC here. Meghan is going to sleep over this weekend. That should be nice.

I don't know what else to say about my life at the moment.

Got a letter from him yesterday and Tony said he'd break my heart. She didn't tell me that today. But she told me, earlier.

Those are the two things I've been thinking about since receiving that letter.

I always forget how things happen. When Tony said that I thought that maybe Crow couldn't break my heart because I had made sure he already had before we even started. From before the beginning I knew it wouldn't last, or maybe not be much, or maybe hurt enough to not need it to last. So I had already done the harm of breaking my own heart. Can you break a heart that's been pre-broken?

He's softening it, or sewing it, or something so that he can someday break it again worse, I guess.
I got the letter, read it, starred at it for a couple of minutes not knowing what to think and then just started balling and balling.

There have been so many things that I just did not expect happening ever since I came to the Singing Company. Nothing that's happened there has been like the rest of the world is.

At Amy's request: What do you think? I got another e-mail from him today. :) I thought he wouldn't respond again because he took a while. And he said I say thing sweetest things...do I? I didn't even remember what I might've said in my last e-mail to him, but he left it under his response. I suppose it must've been the thing about me wanting him to feel comfortable to say anything, no matter if he'll mean it in the future or not. Off topic, I was thinking today that I don't believe in hardly anything. And how that seems almost...I don't know. I feel like for the kind of person I am, I should or something. But I don't believe in God. I rarely believe compliments people tell me. I don't think I believe in true love or love at first site or things like that even though sometimes I pretend I do...I've never believed in soul mates, something I always worried about with Michael. I don't believe people can stay faithful with the right oppurtunities. Sometimes I almost think I don't believe in love. I mean...I do because I swear I've felt it. But at the same time...can you really love someone if you can hurt them? And I think in some way I've hurt everyone I've said I love. And not all of it has been on purpose, but I still have chosen some of the hurtful choices with my eyes open. And if my love is real, then why would I get so scared when I think of the idea that Tony and I could ever be meant to be with each other? If I love her, which I swear if I don't love her I don't love anybody, why should the idea alone scare me? If love is real then why can I not ever imagine being with only one person? I don't think anything could last long enough...nothing could stay satisfying for that long. But not believing in love has got to be pretty stupid, right? Funny thing is, all these things I don't believe in, they're the things I love most about entertainment. I love love stories, any kind-soul mates, love at first site-all of them. I allow myself to fall for everything, I don't protect myself from much, I don't do what's best for me, and yet...I'm not sure what I mean. It seems like I shouldn't do everything I do if I don't believe in anything. Anyways, that's probably all just a bunch of mumble-jumble-thinking too much or me being in a weird mood or something. All that matters right now is that I think I'm going to have a wonderful little trip this week! :D

So I know it's still a while away, but today I went shopping for some nice pants to wear camping (I thought skirts may not be the best). *AND* I even picked the outfit and make-up I'll be wearing for the first time Crow sees me next at the airport! It's going to be a little different than usual because my make-up is very...natural and light. Just a litte eyeliner, not around the whole eye, and not dark. Very light green eye shadow. Light pink lip-stick with no lip liner! Eek! I don't remember the last time I wore that simple of make-up. But I'm ex-cit-ed!

I also got my DVD of Breakfast on Pluto today! I'm thinking if I might try to get Crow to watch it with me...

Hee! :)

You know what Crow said? He said he wanted to take me camping! Isn't that sweet and exciting?
Yes, I know it's probably a high chance that he would change his mind or simply just forget that he ever brought it up, but...it would be fun, wouldn't it?
How would I keep up appearances, yes, I know, but it sounds marvelous enough for him to take me anywhere that I couldn't help but be excited anyways.

Oh...and I certainly hope talking about him in my livejournal doesn't count as telling people about him...the only people that read this are the people that already know, anyways.

I have nothing profound to write. Maybe I should go subject by subject.

About Michael:

Tony seemed to act like it might have meant something if Michael had known when I went out walking with him that I wanted to pull him into a hotel and do him. I don't think it would've made a difference. I don't think I would've persuaded him. Which is why I didn't try, of course. I would've have gone for it if I thought I could do it.

It's not a surprise to me how bad it hurt to have him...not want me around. Not be able to comfort him. Not surprising how much I hated seeing Milo and him go off together. Not surprising how it made me cry to read Michael's entry about Milo. None of it's surprising to me, but not everyone's me. If I'm moving onto new conquests that means I don't care about old ones, that's the stupid assumed idea out there for some people. I miss him. It hurts.

My life's not on pause anymore. If I would've been able to do anything with Michael that day I would've been involved with all three of them, in that one day. Crow, Michael, Tony.

About Tony:

I have even less of an idea of what I can write about her. I now feel that I'm more confused about us than she is. It gives me the feeling that my confusion is hurting her. But Tony's tougher than that. And she knows me better than that. Right? Am I doing wrong by her or does confusion and fear pardon me? Is not being ready wrong?

About Crow:

I felt like I was in a movie. In a dream. It was beautiful. I felt pure and safe and so delicate. I felt young and naive and easily able to dream. I didn't feel any dread. I didn't feel like I wanted to cry for fear of when I would lose what was happening and when the disillusion would happen. I felt so good that it didn't occur for me to think about that until the morning. 

And then seeing Michael and Tony that day, it made everything with Crow feel too new that it must have had to have been shallow and empty compared to them.

I can't think about them all at the same time. Each one taints the other. I'm very disjointed.

I had lunch with some of the other Queens today.
I got shushi. I thought about Michael the whole time I was eating it.
I started talking about him, just the everyday things about him.

I started blubbering and crying all over myself. :(

Am I judgemental of people?
I hope not. I mean, I know I might be when the situation is close to me. But am I when I'm kind of removed from the situation? I don't really get mad when people judge me, but sometimes I get really sad and hurt.

A lot of talk going around about jealousy lately.
I'm so horrible for liking it. And the fact that something hurtful to Michael is what brought on him being more physical with me in public. Kind of like a double-edged sword. I'm getting what I want, but at the expense of someone I love.

Michael, you are never invisable. You didn't need to remind me of who you were there. My attention was on you.

Is it really wrong of me to take down someone else's barriers? Is that something reserved for people who aren't in a relationship with someone else? It's not a question to Michael...just a question, I guess. Maybe to myself. I don't know.

Getting hurt and getting what you want are close together. Maybe I can feel so much hurt because I take more risks than some? And maybe getting what I want sometimes is what hurts me. Maybe I want the wrong things, or maybe I only get half of what I want.
It's true that sex is important to me, but of course I'm hurt if that's all I can manage to get.

I don't know. It's just a little bit of me thinking aloud.

Keep being comforted about what Tony said. About things hurting in me more or something like that.

And I remember my teacher commenting on how sad it was that she had to take the route of saying she was supposed to be male to be a ruler. I remember it being a feminist issue with her.
